revision.comment: Created page with "Possibly: The general counting-house, and man of business. Calculated to promote facility and accuracy in accounts of business, relative to the Merchant, the Banker, Underwr..."
revision.text: Possibly: The general counting-house, and man of business. Calculated to promote facility and accuracy in accounts of business, relative to the Merchant, the Banker, Underwriter, Broker, Factor, Employer, Drawer, Remitter, Partner, Trustee, Manufacturer, Warehouse-Keeper, Shopkeeper, Storekeeper, Landed Gentleman, Chamberlain, Farmer, &c. With the method of negotiating bills of exchange, in all the trading countries in Europe. By William Gordon, Author of the Universal Accountant. (Edinburgh : Printed for A. Donaldson, and sold at his shops in London and Edinburgh, MDCCLXVI [1766]). http://library.st-andrews.ac.uk/record=b1873488~S1
